articles.author: Associated Press
articles.title: US citizen dies in Egyptian prison after hunger strike
articles.description: The U.S. State Department says an American citizen, who was on hunger strike in prison in Egypt and who claimed he was wrongfully detained, has died after spending six years behind bars
articles.content: His death in custody was needless, tragic and avoidable, Assistant Secretary of State for Near Eastern Affairs David Schenker told reporters. I will continue to raise our serious concerns about human rights and Americans detained in Egypt at every opportunity… [+1501 chars]

articles.title: Libya's rival leaders leave Moscow, no peace deal signed
articles.description: Libya's rival leaders have left Moscow without reaching an agreement on a cease-fire deal proposed by Russia and Turkey in an effort to bring an end to the country's long-running civil war
articles.content: After the meetings, Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov and his Turkish counterpart, Mevlut Cavusoglu, announced that Sarraj signed the draft document spelling out the details of the proposed cease-fire deal, while Hifter requested more time to consider it… [+1402 chars]

articles.author: Sheikh Saaliq | AP
articles.title: Indian state challenges new citizenship law in court
articles.description: India's southern Kerala has became the first state to legally challenge a new citizenship law that has triggered nationwide demonstrations
articles.content: The citizenship law backed by Prime Minister Narendra Modis Hindu nationalist party provides a path to naturalization for people from Bangladesh, Afghanistan and Pakistan, unless theyre Muslim. It has led to nationwide protests and clashes with police, leadin… [+1210 chars]

articles.author: Associated Press
articles.title: Turkey: 115 soldiers detained over links to US-based cleric
articles.description: Turkish authorities have detained 115 soldiers who are suspected of links to the U.S.-based Muslim cleric blamed by Turkey for a failed coup attempt in 2016
articles.content:
The report said 108 of the soldiers are currently on active duty. The suspects include six F-16 pilots and four district gendarmerie commanders, the agency reported.
On July 15, 2016, a group of officers attempted a coup to overthrow Turkish President Recep … [+554 chars]

articles.title: Australian village scorched by wildfires struggles with loss

articles.author: Joe McDonald | AP
articles.title: China's exports end 2019 up 0.5% despite US tariff war
articles.description: China's global exports rose 0.5% in 2019 despite a tariff war with Washington as the two governments prepared to sign an interim trade deal
articles.content:
The impact of Trumps tariff hikes in a fight over Beijings technology ambitions and trade surplus has been smaller than forecasters expected.
Famously resilient Chinese exporters have pursued other markets, stepping up sales to Asia, Europe and Africa. China… [+2401 chars]

articles.author: Associated Press
articles.title: Prosecutors: Police raiding premises in 4 German states
articles.description: Prosecutors say police are conducting raids in four German states early Tuesday on suspicion of a planned serious "violent crime
articles.content:
The raids are taking place in Berlin, Brandenburg, North Rhine-Westphalia and Thuringia states.

articles.title: Iraqis worry US-Iran tensions are eclipsing their protests

articles.title: Bus falls after road collapses in China, 10 dead or missing
articles.description: Authorities say a bus plunged through a collapsed section of road in northwestern China, killing at least six people and leaving four missing
articles.content:
The collapse Monday afternoon left 16 people in the hospital. The bureau said the bus had been raised from the collapsed 80-square meter (860-square foot) section into which it had fallen.

articles.title: Afghan official: Bombs kill 2 children in northern province
